Material used.Material Name: Patients with Parkinson's disease and healthy controls
Material used.Description: The study compared DNA samples from patients with Parkinson's disease and healthy controls to identify genetic variants associated with the disease.

Readout description.Result Description: The R1441G variant was significantly associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease (p < 0.001).
The G2019S variant was strongly linked to Parkinson's disease (odds ratio 3.2, 95% CI 2.1–4.8).
The Y1699C variant showed a moderate association with Parkinson's disease (p = 0.02).

Biological replicates.Description: The study was replicated in two independent cohorts with consistent results.

Technical replicates.Description: Technical replicates were not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: No explicit positive control was mentioned in the study.

Basic negative control.Description: No explicit negative control was mentioned in the study.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Logistic regression and meta-analysis were used to assess associations.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: p-value > 0.05 for association with Parkinson's disease.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: p-value ≤ 0.05 for association with Parkinson's disease.
